SEARCH
Package Lybrinth

Class Hero

java.lang.Object
Lybrinth.Things
Lybrinth.SolidThings
Lybrinth.AnimatedThings
Lybrinth.DynamicThings
Lybrinth.Hero
public final class Hero extends DynamicThings
The `Lybrinth.Hero` class represents the player's character in the game. It is a singleton class responsible for managing the hero's attributes, movement, health, and interactions with other game objects. The hero can move in different orientations, has a health attribute, and can interact with traps, food, and the exit in the game's dungeon.

    • getInstance

      public static Hero getInstance(double x, double y, double width, double height)
      Get the instance of the Lybrinth.Hero class using the singleton pattern.
      Parameters:
      x - The initial x-coordinate of the hero.
      y - The initial y-coordinate of the hero.
      width - The width of the hero's bounding box.
      height - The height of the hero's bounding box.
      Returns:
      The singleton instance of the Lybrinth.Hero class.

    • setOrientation

      Set the orientation of the hero, which determines the direction the hero is facing.
      Parameters:

      public void setWalking(boolean walking)
      Set whether the hero is currently walking or not.
      Parameters:
      walking - `true` if the hero is walking, `false` otherwise.

    • decreaseHealth

      public void decreaseHealth(int amount)
      Decrease the health of the hero by the specified amount. Used when the hero passes into a trap.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount by which to decrease the hero's health.

    • increaseHealth

      public void increaseHealth(int amount)
      Increase the health of the hero by the specified amount, up to a maximum of 100. Used when the user passes through food.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount by which to increase the hero's health.

    • moveIfPossible

      public void moveIfPossible(double dx, double dy, Dungeon dungeon)
      Move the hero if possible based on the specified changes in x and y coordinates. Check if the hero gets into a trap or picks up food.
      Overrides:
      moveIfPossible in class DynamicThings
      Parameters:
      dx - The change in the x-coordinate.
      dy - The change in the y-coordinate.
      dungeon - The game's dungeon where collisions are checked.

    • hasReachedExit

      public boolean hasReachedExit(Dungeon dungeon)
      Check if the hero has reached the exit in the dungeon.
      Parameters:
      dungeon - The game's dungeon.
      Returns:
      `true` if the hero has reached the exit, `false` otherwise.

    • nextLevel

      public void nextLevel()
      Move the hero to the next level of the game if possible. This method increments the hero's level.
